File#

Here, functions for files

namespace file#

Functions

void add_twofiles(std::string filepath_input1, std::string filepath_input2, std::string filepath_output)#

Opens two textfiles and writes it in another.

Parameters:

  • filepath_input1 – First file name to be written into a new one

  • filepath_input2 – First file name to be written into a new one

  • filepath_output – where the content is written to

Throws:

runtime_error – : if input1 or input2 cannot be read

bool byteCopy(const std::string &src, const std::string &dest, std::size_t blockSize, bool progress = false)#

Copy a file.

Author

Mike, Lucas

Parameters:

  • src – Source File

  • dest – Destination file

  • blockSize – Size of the block to be copied at once

  • progress – Print out a progress bar

Throws:

runtime_error – : if source file does not exist

Returns:

bool

int copy(mml::string src, mml::string dst, std::string name_in = "", std::string name_ex = "", size_t blocksize = _100MB, bool verbose = false, bool verbose_debug = false, bool all = false, bool recursive = false, bool force = false, bool progress = false, bool falsewrite = false)#

Copy the content of the path to a new one.

Todo:

Copy symbolic and hard link file by creating them

Parameters:

  • src – Source Path

  • dst – Destination path

  • name_in – Copy only files including this string in depth = 1

  • name_ex – Exclude all files and directories with this name

  • blocksize – Blocksize to be copied at once

  • verbose – Verbose output

  • verbose_debug – Debugging output

  • all – Copy also hidden files

  • recursive – Copy recursive

  • force – Overwrite everything without asking

  • progress – Print out the progress while copying

  • falsewrite – Do not overwrite files in the destination

Throws:

  • logic_error – : If a file is to be copied but dst is a directory

  • logic_error – : If destination exists as a file if a directory is copied

  • runtime_error – : If user is not permitted to write into the destination

  • runtime_error – : If last directory in destionation is not a directory

Returns:

0 if successfull

bool equal(std::string src, std::string dst)#

Compare two files by using the SHA256 algorithm. Only works for linux.

Parameters:

  • src – Source file

  • dst – Destination file

Returns:

bool if sha256 is the same

std::string humanread(std::size_t number)#

Convert number into human readable number.

Parameters:

number – A number to be converted

Returns:

std::string

std::size_t num_lines(std::string path)#

Determine number of lines in a file.

Parameters:

path – Path to the file

Returns:

size_t Number of lines

int Program_exist(std::string program)#

Checks if a program exists.

Parameters:

program – Program to be checked

void remove(std::string file)#

Author

Mike

Note

Delete a single file

Parameters:

file – path to the file

void set_date_dir(mml::string src, mml::string dst, std::vector<std::string> ends = {"NEF", "tif", "JPG", "jpg", "MP4", "MOV", "PNG", "HEIC", "JPEG", "jpeg", "pdf", "PDF"}, bool recursive = false, bool all = false, bool verbose = false)#

Note

Convert the date of files with specific endings in a directory

Note

This function is only defined for linux systems

Parameters:

  • src – Source path

  • dst – Destination path

  • ends – Endings to be checked

  • recursive – Recursive check

  • all – Also check hidden files

  • verbose – Verbose output

std::size_t size(const std::string &filename)#

Calculates the size of a file.

Author

Lucas

Parameters:

filename – Path to the file

Throws:

runtime_error – : if file does not exist

Returns:

Size of the file

std::string size_human(const std::string &filename, bool verbose = true)#

Calculates the size of a file.

Parameters:

  • filename – Path to the file

  • verbose – Print out

Throws:

runtime_error – : if file does not exist

Returns:

Returns the size of a file in a readable form as a string

std::string size_dir(mml::string &dir, std::string include = "", std::string exclude = "", bool verbose = false, bool recursive = false, bool all = false, bool human_readable = false) noexcept#

Calculates the size of a directory structure.

Parameters:

  • dir – Path to the directory

  • include – Include only count objects having this string in its name

  • exclude – Exclude objects with this name from the count

  • verbose – Verbose print out

  • recursive – Recursive check

  • all – Also count hidden files

  • human_readable – Print out in human readable form

Returns:

Returns the size of the directory

time_t time_mod(const std::string &filename)#

Returns the last modified time of a file in seconds.

Parameters:

filename – Path to the file

Returns:

Seconds since 1970
